message.content:
First, I will carefully analyze the income statement to identify the line item related to the "carrying amount of inventories sold" during the reporting period.

In income statements, the cost associated with inventories sold is usually represented by "Cost of Goods Sold" (COGS). The "carrying amount of inventories sold" refers to the value assigned to the inventory that was sold, which is captured by this line item.

Looking at the provided table:
- The line item "Cost of Goods Sold" shows a value of 1,337,000.00 on 2024-02-05.

Therefore, the specific line item of interest is "Cost of Goods Sold" with the amount of 1,337,000.00.
